title: Israel and Hamas Meet in Egypt to Discuss Gaza Peace Plan
summary: As Israelis brace for a day of mourning and commemoration, negotiators for Israel and Hamas met with mediators in Egypt to hash out an end to the war.

title: A Former Israeli Hostage Is Freed From Hamas, but Not Captivity
summary: In the tunnels of Gaza where she was held captive, Emily Damari learned how to survive. These photos show her learning to be alive again.

title: Trying to Survive Gaza’s War-Torn Present, and Hoping for a Future
summary: Two years of intense warfare in Gaza has left its people with a dismembered and disordered society. The destruction is vast and many Gazans have mental and physical wounds that could scar a generation.

title: Shutdown Politics Has Republicans Singing Government’s Praises
summary: As Republicans try to pin blame for shutdown damage on Democrats, they are hailing a federal bureaucracy they normally bash as wasteful and overreaching.

title: Flight Delays Begin as Air Traffic Staffing Shortages Worsen
summary: The delays came just hours after the transportation secretary warned that flying could be disrupted by the government shutdown.

title: Pentagon Relaxes Press Access Rules
summary: Under new guidelines, journalists will not need approval from the Defense Department before publishing articles containing information not officially released.

title: How Trump’s National Guard Deployments Break With Military Tradition
summary: By sending troops to U.S. cities that are not in active crisis, President Trump is breaking with military tradition. Helene Cooper, who covers national security issues for The New York Times, compares his recent actions with earlier domestic military deployments.

title: Trump Gave Partisan Speech to Navy Troops, as He Deployed Troops to U.S. Cities
summary: President Trump’s attempts to politicize the military have become more overt as he makes the case for having troops at his disposal in American cities.

title: Neighbors Warn Neighbors as Fear of ICE Ripples Across Chicago
summary: Parents are standing guard at schools. Some restaurants have stopped delivering food or simply closed. “Every single person who looks brown is scared,” a lawyer said.

title: Trump Said He Could Invoke the Insurrection Act to Deploy Troops. Here’s What to Know.
summary: The president said he would invoke emergency powers to deploy the National Guard if “people were being killed, and courts were holding us up.”

title: Harvard Has Identified Another Problem: Its Own Students
summary: Many students don’t do the reading and don’t speak up in class, according to a report. Now, professors are trying to change a campus culture they say hurts achievement and stifles speech.

title: A Harvard Professor Is Placed on Leave After Firing a Pellet Gun
summary: The episode initially raised concerns because it happened near a synagogue, but the police say it was unrelated to antisemitism.

title: Can Sweet Songs Prevail Over Bloody Ones? Mexico Is Giving It a Try.
summary: On Sunday, three contestants were crowned winners of the inaugural, government-run “Mexico Sings” competition, meant to promote songs that aren’t about drug cartels or violence.

title: With Sébastien Lecornu’s Resignation, France Faces Increasing Turmoil
summary: The record-fast collapse of yet another government confronts President Emmanuel Macron and his country with an intensifying crisis.

title: Elon Musk Gambles on Sexy A.I. Companions
summary: In July, the billionaire’s A.I. company introduced two sexually explicit chatbots, pushing a new version of intimacy.

title: Undersea Bacteria Feast on Methane. Can They Help Cool the Planet?
summary: They feast on bubbles of methane seeping out of the ocean floor. Could their appetites be harnessed to slow climate change?

title: Marine Park in Ontario Warns It May Euthanize Beluga Whales Without Cash Infusion
summary: The government has barred Marineland from shipping its whales to an aquarium in China so the park is threatening to put the whales down.

title: Lessons From a Long War
summary: The only viable path to a Palestinian state is an end to the fantasy of Israel’s destruction.

title: The Right’s Civil War Over Who Really Killed Charlie Kirk
summary: MAGA is tearing itself apart over who really killed Charlie Kirk.

title: France’s Energy Giant Sees Opportunity in the Volatile Electricity Market
summary: Hoping to help grid operators adapt to changes buffeting the power markets, TotalEnergies is assembling a portfolio of battery farms and natural-gas-fired power plants.

title: Supreme Court, for Now, Rejects Google Bid to Block Changes to App Store
summary: The emergency order is the latest turn in a longstanding legal dispute between the tech giant and the creator of the popular game Fortnite.

title: Where in the World Is Eric Adams? Try Albania.
summary: The decision by Mr. Adams, a lame-duck mayor, to spend nearly a week of his remaining time in office visiting the Balkan nation raised eyebrows back in New York.
